Present location: BIBLIOTHECA ALEXANDRINA ANTIQUETIES MUSEUM [01/027] ALEXANDRIA BAAM
Name: Terra Sigillata Plaque
Description: A fragment of a plaque on which, at the top, two persons are shown facing each other with a tree between them. The two were called respectively, the Mauritanian and the African. At the top of the scene there are two figures of predatory animals. The plaque is made of terra sigillata, which has a red glaze and was a kind of pottery that was imported from Arezzo in Italy in the middle of the second century B.C. It was popular in the countries of the Mediterranean during the Hellenistic period.
